A selection of summary functions from Hmisc

Source: R/stat-summary.r
hmisc.Rd

These are wrappers around functions from Hmisc designed to make them easier to use with stat_summary(). See the Hmisc documentation for more details:

  • Hmisc::smean.cl.boot()

  • Hmisc::smean.cl.normal()

  • Hmisc::smean.sdl()

  • Hmisc::smedian.hilow()

mean_cl_boot(x, ...)

mean_cl_normal(x, ...)

mean_sdl(x, ...)

median_hilow(x, ...)

Arguments

x

a numeric vector
...

other arguments passed on to the respective Hmisc function.

Value

A data frame with columns y, ymin, and ymax.

Examples

x <- rnorm(100)
mean_cl_boot(x)
#>             y       ymin      ymax
#> 1 0.006340126 -0.1833846 0.1899812
mean_cl_normal(x)
#>             y       ymin      ymax
#> 1 0.006340126 -0.1796911 0.1923714
mean_sdl(x)
#>             y     ymin    ymax
#> 1 0.006340126 -1.86877 1.88145
median_hilow(x)
#>            y      ymin     ymax
#> 1 0.03095268 -1.820273 1.860058
